response_metadata.response_text:
{
"overview": "The purpose and intent of this measure is to establish the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund, repeal two existing conference center revolving funds, and appropriate funds from the new fund (HB1169_SD1). The University of Hawai‘i (UH) supports the bill, which would \"facilitate the administration of the fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the UH system\" (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_). The Committee on Higher Education has amended this measure by \"Making it effective upon its approval\" and recommends that it pass Second Reading and be referred to the Committee on Ways and Means (HB1169_SD1).",
"appropriations": "This measure will \"Lapse all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund\" (HB1169_SD1). It also intends to \"Appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund\" (HB1169_SD1). No specific dollar amounts for new appropriations are provided in the documents.",
"assumptions_and_methodology": "The methodology for the new fund's structure is based on existing successful models within the University of Hawai'i system. This structure is intended to \"mirror successful models of other UH funds, notably the Tuition and Fees Special Fund, the Auxiliary Enterprises Special Fund, and the Student Activities Revolving Fund\" (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_). This approach would allow all campuses to standardize conference center programs while eliminating redundant statutory provisions (HB1169_SD1).",
"agency_impact": "The University of Hawaiʻi System submitted testimony in support of this measure (HB1169_SD1). The bill is expected to positively impact the agency by allowing all campuses to \"utilize their own account within this overarching fund,\" which will help \"standardize conference center programs across all campuses while eliminating unnecessary duplication of statutes\" (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_). This structure is intended to make the fund consistent with other existing University of Hawaii funds (HB1169_SD1).",
"economic_impact": "Creating a single University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund is expected to create efficiencies by \"eliminating redundant provisions\" (HB1169_SD1). This consolidation would allow the university system to \"standardize conference center programs across all campuses while eliminating unnecessary duplication of statutes\" (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_). The measure aims to make the fund structure \"consistent with other existing University of Hawaii funds\" (HB1169_SD1).",
"policy_impact": "The Committee on Higher Education has amended this measure by \"Making it effective upon its approval\" and making \"technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity and consistency\" (HB1169_SD1). With these amendments, the committee recommends that H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, pass Second Reading as H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 1 (HB1169_SD1). The measure is now referred to the Committee on Ways and Means (HB1169_SD1).",
"revenue_sources": "The initial funding for the new University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund will come from the balances of the two funds it is replacing. The measure specifies to \"Lapse all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund\" (HB1169_SD1). The documents do not identify any new sources of revenue.",
"six_year_fiscal_implications": "The previous fiscal note's expectation of immediate fiscal implications is now confirmed, as the Committee on Higher Education has amended the measure by \"Making it effective upon its approval\" (HB1169_SD1). This bill would create one UH Conference Center Revolving Fund and allow all campuses to have their own account within it, which would standardize conference center programs and eliminate \"unnecessary duplication of statutes\" (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_). This new structure would mirror other successful UH funds like the Tuition and Fees Special Fund (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_). The measure repeals the existing Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund, lapsing all their appropriations and encumbrances to the new fund (HB1169_SD1). While this consolidation implies administrative savings, the documents do not provide specific cost or revenue projections for the six-year period.",
"operating_revenue_impact": "This measure will consolidate existing operating revenues from two separate funds into a single, new revolving fund. It directs to \"Lapse all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund\" (HB1169_SD1). This will not create new revenue but will centralize the administration of funds for conference center programs across the University of Hawaii System (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_).",
"capital_expenditure_impact": "",
"fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "",
"updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The primary update is the bill's progression to the Senate Committee on Higher Education, which has amended it and recommends it pass Second Reading as H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 1 (HB1169_SD1). The committee's amendment makes the bill \"effective upon its approval,\" officially removing the prior version's deferred effective date and confirming the immediate fiscal impact previously anticipated (HB1169_SD1). The University of Hawaiʻi System provided testimony in support, noting the new structure would \"mirror successful models of other UH funds\" (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_)."
}

parts.text:
{
"overview": "The purpose and intent of this measure is to establish the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund, repeal two existing conference center revolving funds, and appropriate funds from the new fund (HB1169_SD1). The University of Hawai‘i (UH) supports the bill, which would \"facilitate the administration of the fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the UH system\" (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_). The Committee on Higher Education has amended this measure by \"Making it effective upon its approval\" and recommends that it pass Second Reading and be referred to the Committee on Ways and Means (HB1169_SD1).",
"appropriations": "This measure will \"Lapse all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund\" (HB1169_SD1). It also intends to \"Appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund\" (HB1169_SD1). No specific dollar amounts for new appropriations are provided in the documents.",
"assumptions_and_methodology": "The methodology for the new fund's structure is based on existing successful models within the University of Hawai'i system. This structure is intended to \"mirror successful models of other UH funds, notably the Tuition and Fees Special Fund, the Auxiliary Enterprises Special Fund, and the Student Activities Revolving Fund\" (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_). This approach would allow all campuses to standardize conference center programs while eliminating redundant statutory provisions (HB1169_SD1).",
"agency_impact": "The University of Hawaiʻi System submitted testimony in support of this measure (HB1169_SD1). The bill is expected to positively impact the agency by allowing all campuses to \"utilize their own account within this overarching fund,\" which will help \"standardize conference center programs across all campuses while eliminating unnecessary duplication of statutes\" (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_). This structure is intended to make the fund consistent with other existing University of Hawaii funds (HB1169_SD1).",
"economic_impact": "Creating a single University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund is expected to create efficiencies by \"eliminating redundant provisions\" (HB1169_SD1). This consolidation would allow the university system to \"standardize conference center programs across all campuses while eliminating unnecessary duplication of statutes\" (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_). The measure aims to make the fund structure \"consistent with other existing University of Hawaii funds\" (HB1169_SD1).",
"policy_impact": "The Committee on Higher Education has amended this measure by \"Making it effective upon its approval\" and making \"technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity and consistency\" (HB1169_SD1). With these amendments, the committee recommends that H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, pass Second Reading as H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 1 (HB1169_SD1). The measure is now referred to the Committee on Ways and Means (HB1169_SD1).",
"revenue_sources": "The initial funding for the new University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund will come from the balances of the two funds it is replacing. The measure specifies to \"Lapse all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund\" (HB1169_SD1). The documents do not identify any new sources of revenue.",
"six_year_fiscal_implications": "The previous fiscal note's expectation of immediate fiscal implications is now confirmed, as the Committee on Higher Education has amended the measure by \"Making it effective upon its approval\" (HB1169_SD1). This bill would create one UH Conference Center Revolving Fund and allow all campuses to have their own account within it, which would standardize conference center programs and eliminate \"unnecessary duplication of statutes\" (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_). This new structure would mirror other successful UH funds like the Tuition and Fees Special Fund (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_). The measure repeals the existing Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund, lapsing all their appropriations and encumbrances to the new fund (HB1169_SD1). While this consolidation implies administrative savings, the documents do not provide specific cost or revenue projections for the six-year period.",
"operating_revenue_impact": "This measure will consolidate existing operating revenues from two separate funds into a single, new revolving fund. It directs to \"Lapse all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund\" (HB1169_SD1). This will not create new revenue but will centralize the administration of funds for conference center programs across the University of Hawaii System (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_).",
"capital_expenditure_impact": "",
"fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "",
"updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The primary update is the bill's progression to the Senate Committee on Higher Education, which has amended it and recommends it pass Second Reading as H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 1 (HB1169_SD1). The committee's amendment makes the bill \"effective upon its approval,\" officially removing the prior version's deferred effective date and confirming the immediate fiscal impact previously anticipated (HB1169_SD1). The University of Hawaiʻi System provided testimony in support, noting the new structure would \"mirror successful models of other UH funds\" (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_)."
}

{
"overview": "The purpose and intent of this measure is to establish the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund, repeal two existing conference center revolving funds, and appropriate funds from the new fund (HB1169_SD1)

The University of Hawai‘i (UH) supports the bill, which would \"facilitate the administration of the fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the UH system\" (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_)

The Committee on Higher Education has amended this measure by \"Making it effective upon its approval\" and recommends that it pass Second Reading and be referred to the Committee on Ways and Means (HB1169_SD1)

",
"appropriations": "This measure will \"Lapse all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund\" (HB1169_SD1)
It also intends to \"Appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund\" (HB1169_SD1)
No specific dollar amounts for new appropriations are provided in the documents

",

This structure is intended to \"mirror successful models of other UH funds, notably the Tuition and Fees Special Fund, the Auxiliary Enterprises Special Fund, and the Student Activities Revolving Fund\" (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_)
This approach would allow all campuses to standardize conference center programs while eliminating redundant statutory provisions (HB1169_SD1)

The bill is expected to positively impact the agency by allowing all campuses to \"utilize their own account within this overarching fund,\" which will help \"standardize conference center programs across all campuses while eliminating unnecessary duplication of statutes\" (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_)
This structure is intended to make the fund consistent with other existing University of Hawaii funds (HB1169_SD1)

With these amendments, the committee recommends that H
D. 1, pass Second Reading as H
The measure is now referred to the Committee on Ways and Means (HB1169_SD1)

The measure specifies to \"Lapse all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund\" (HB1169_SD1)
The documents do not identify any new sources of revenue

This bill would create one UH Conference Center Revolving Fund and allow all campuses to have their own account within it, which would standardize conference center programs and eliminate \"unnecessary duplication of statutes\" (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_)
This new structure would mirror other successful UH funds like the Tuition and Fees Special Fund (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_)

The measure repeals the existing Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund, lapsing all their appropriations and encumbrances to the new fund (HB1169_SD1)
While this consolidation implies administrative savings, the documents do not provide specific cost or revenue projections for the six-year period

",

It directs to \"Lapse all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund\" (HB1169_SD1)
This will not create new revenue but will centralize the administration of funds for conference center programs across the University of Hawaii System (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_)

The University of Hawaiʻi System provided testimony in support, noting the new structure would \"mirror successful models of other UH funds\" (HB1169_HD1_TESTIMONY_HRE_03-11-25_)

chunk_details.chunk_text: UNIVERSITY OF HAWAI‘I SYSTEM ʻŌNAEHANA KULANUI O HAWAIʻI Legislative Testimony Hōʻike Manaʻo I Mua O Ka ʻAhaʻōlelo _____________________________________________________________ Testimony Presented Before the Senate Committee on Higher Education March 11, 2025 at 3:00 p.m. By Kalbert K. Young Vice President for Budget and Finance/Chief Financial Officer University of Hawai‘i System HB

Budget and Finance/Chief Financial Officer University of Hawai‘i System HB 1169 HD1 – RELATING TO UNIVERSITY OF HAWAII CONFERENCE CENTER REVOLVING FUND Chair Kim, Vice Chair Kidani, and Members of the Committee: Thank you for the opportunity to present testimony today. The University of Hawai‘i (UH) supports HB 1169 HD1,

today. The University of Hawai‘i (UH) supports HB 1169 HD1, Relating to University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. This bill establishes the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund and accounts under the fund to facilitate the administration of the fund for conference center programs among various campuses and

the fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the UH system. Conference Center Revolving Funds currently exist for the Community Colleges and UH-Hilo. This bill would create one UH Conference Center Revolving Fund and allow all campuses to utilize their own account within this overarching

all campuses to utilize their own account within this overarching fund. This would allow all campuses to standardize conference center programs across all campuses while eliminating unnecessary duplication of statutes. This structure would mirror successful models of other UH funds, notably the Tuition and Fees Special Fund, the Auxiliary Enterprises

notably the Tuition and Fees Special Fund, the Auxiliary Enterprises Special Fund, and the Student Activities Revolving Fund. Thank you for this opportunity to testify. e- A¢$ 2‘ D 0”‘ q“ 4' $41 Q KA ¢j\\\\>\ \'\'Y Op /03 |su7 _A~2~ \,\“‘9 4‘4p°No

SSCR1134 STAND. COM. REP. NO. 1134 Honolulu, Hawaii RE: H.B. No. 1169 H.D. 1 S.D. 1 Honorable Ronald D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Sir: Your Committee on Higher Education, to which was referred H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, entitled:

to which was referred H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO UNIVERSITY OF HAWAII CONFERENCE CENTER REVOLVING FUND," begs leave to report as follows: The purpose and intent of this measure is to: (1) Establish the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to

Establish the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of the revolving fund for conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System; (2) Repeal the Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community

and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund; (3) Lapse all appropriations and encumbrances of the Conference Center Revolving Fund and the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving

Revolving Fund to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund; and (4) Appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. Your Committee received testimony in support of this measure from the University of Hawai ʻ i System. Your Committee finds that creating a single University

i System. Your Committee finds that creating a single University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund, with each campus having an account in the overarching fund, would allow all campuses to standardize conference center programs across all campuses while eliminating redundant provisions. Your Committee further finds that structuring the University

redundant provisions. Your Committee further finds that structuring the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund in this manner would make it consistent with other existing University of Hawaii funds, including the Tuition and Fees Special Fund. Your Committee has amended this measure by: (1) Making it effective upon its

amended this measure by: (1) Making it effective upon its approval; and (2) Making technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity and consistency. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Higher Education that is attached to this report, your Committee is in

that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, as amended herein, and recommends that it pass Second Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 1, and be referred to your

1169, H.D. 1, S.D. 1, and be referred to your Committee on Ways and Means. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee on Higher Education, ________________________________ DONNA MERCADO KIM, Chair
